page.title: 09THE BELL INN WILLERSEY
page.content: {The Bell Inn}was originally a fourteenth century farmhouse and stands back on the village green opposite the duck pond. It has been a pub for one hundred and forty years and has only had four landlords. The customers' ages vary from the youngest at seventeen to the oldest who is eighty eight and still enjoys his morning pint. There are six darts teams and three quiz teams.The main feature of the Bell is a unique collection of mugs. There are five hundred and eighty in all ranging from a complete set of first and second division football club mugs to the many commemorative ones of which some date back to Queen Victoria's time. Outside The Bell there is a collection of old farming implements.
